cont.entity_a: Zinc square with a hardened scribe.

cont.entity_b: Etched ruler markings are durable. Heavy and prone to rust.

cont.entity_a: Value for the price is excellent. Great value for money.
cont.entity_b: Expensive compared to other squares. Expensive but worth the investment for precision.

cont.entity_a: Bubble level is useless due to short reference edge.
cont.entity_b: Level lost liquid after two years.

cont.entity_a: Fit and finish are good and tight.
cont.entity_b: Satin finish reduces glare for easier reading. Clear and easy-to-read markings.

cont.entity_a: Locking mechanism does not lock properly. Machining on the locking mechanism is not perfect.
cont.entity_b: Smooth ruler movement and locks well. Lock works well and stays tight. No wiggle or play when set screw is tightened.

cont.entity_a: Square is accurate when checked with Japanese Mitutoyo. Accurate for imprecise work. Accurate 90 degrees angle confirmed against a square. Accurate compared to calibrated tools.
cont.entity_b: Precision is high, suitable for woodworking. Easy to read and precise numbers.

cont.entity_a: Easy to mark lines with the embedded scribe.
Well made and performs well. Stainless steel construction prevents rusting.
cont.entity_b: Sturdy construction and smooth action. Rust accumulates easily in humid environments.

cont.entity_a: Sharp edges and manufacturing burrs present. Edges of the scale are sharp and uncomfortable. Sharp edges and heavy for its size.
Scriber arrived broken. Ruler was bent and unusable.
